built with pdoc

borsapy

borsapy - Turkish Financial Markets Data Library

A yfinance-like API for BIST stocks, forex, crypto, funds, and economic data.

Examples:

import borsapy as bp

# Get stock data
>>> stock = bp.Ticker("THYAO")
>>> stock.info  # Real-time quote
>>> stock.history(period="1mo")  # OHLCV data
>>> stock.balance_sheet  # Financial statements

# Get forex/commodity data
>>> usd = bp.FX("USD")
>>> usd.current  # Current rate
>>> usd.history(period="1mo")  # Historical data
>>> usd.bank_rates  # Bank exchange rates
>>> usd.bank_rate("akbank")  # Single bank rate
>>> bp.banks()  # List supported banks
>>> gold = bp.FX("gram-altin")

# List all BIST companies
>>> bp.companies()
>>> bp.search_companies("banka")

# Get crypto data
>>> btc = bp.Crypto("BTCTRY")
>>> btc.current  # Current price
>>> btc.history(period="1mo")  # Historical OHLCV
>>> bp.crypto_pairs()  # List available pairs

# Get fund data
>>> fund = bp.Fund("AAK")
>>> fund.info  # Fund details
>>> fund.history(period="1mo")  # Price history

# Get inflation data
>>> inf = bp.Inflation()
>>> inf.latest()  # Latest TÃœFE data
>>> inf.calculate(100000, "2020-01", "2024-01")  # Inflation calculation

# Economic calendar
>>> cal = bp.EconomicCalendar()
>>> cal.events(period="1w")  # This week's events
>>> cal.today()  # Today's events
>>> bp.economic_calendar(country="TR", importance="high")

# Government bonds
>>> bp.bonds()  # All bond yields
>>> bond = bp.Bond("10Y")
>>> bond.yield_rate  # Current 10Y yield
>>> bp.risk_free_rate()  # For DCF calculations

# Stock screener
>>> bp.screen_stocks(template="high_dividend")
>>> bp.screen_stocks(market_cap_min=1000, pe_max=15)
>>> screener = bp.Screener()
>>> screener.add_filter("dividend_yield", min=3).run()

class Ticker: 
 467class Ticker:
 468    """
 469    A yfinance-like interface for Turkish stock data.
 470
 471    Examples:
 472        >>> import borsapy as bp
 473        >>> stock = bp.Ticker("THYAO")
 474        >>> stock.info
 475        {'symbol': 'THYAO', 'last': 268.5, ...}
 476        >>> stock.history(period="1mo")
 477                         Open    High     Low   Close    Volume
 478        Date
 479        2024-12-01    265.00  268.00  264.00  267.50  12345678
 480        ...
 481    """
 482
 483    def __init__(self, symbol: str):
 484        """
 485        Initialize a Ticker object.
 486
 487        Args:
 488            symbol: Stock symbol (e.g., "THYAO", "GARAN", "ASELS").
 489                    The ".IS" or ".E" suffix is optional and will be removed.
 490        """
 491        self._symbol = symbol.upper().replace(".IS", "").replace(".E", "")
 492        self._paratic = get_paratic_provider()
 493        self._isyatirim = None  # Lazy load for financial statements
 494        self._kap = None  # Lazy load for KAP disclosures
 495        self._isin_provider = None  # Lazy load for ISIN lookup
 496        self._hedeffiyat = None  # Lazy load for analyst price targets
 497
 498    def _get_isyatirim(self):
 499        """Lazy load Ä°ÅŸ YatÄ±rÄ±m provider for financial statements."""
 500        if self._isyatirim is None:
 501            from borsapy._providers.isyatirim import get_isyatirim_provider
 502
 503            self._isyatirim = get_isyatirim_provider()
 504        return self._isyatirim
 505
 506    def _get_kap(self):
 507        """Lazy load KAP provider for disclosures and calendar."""
 508        if self._kap is None:
 509            from borsapy._providers.kap import get_kap_provider
 510
 511            self._kap = get_kap_provider()
 512        return self._kap
 513
 514    def _get_isin_provider(self):
 515        """Lazy load ISIN provider."""
 516        if self._isin_provider is None:
 517            from borsapy._providers.isin import get_isin_provider
 518
 519            self._isin_provider = get_isin_provider()
 520        return self._isin_provider
 521
 522    def _get_hedeffiyat(self):
 523        """Lazy load hedeffiyat.com.tr provider for analyst price targets."""
 524        if self._hedeffiyat is None:
 525            from borsapy._providers.hedeffiyat import get_hedeffiyat_provider
 526
 527            self._hedeffiyat = get_hedeffiyat_provider()
 528        return self._hedeffiyat
 529
 530    @property
 531    def symbol(self) -> str:
 532        """Return the ticker symbol."""
 533        return self._symbol
 534
 535    @property
 536    def fast_info(self) -> FastInfo:
 537        """
 538        Get fast access to common ticker information.
 539
 540        Returns a FastInfo object with quick access to frequently used data:
 541        - currency, exchange, timezone
 542        - last_price, open, day_high, day_low, previous_close, volume
 543        - market_cap, shares, pe_ratio, pb_ratio
 544        - year_high, year_low (52-week)
 545        - fifty_day_average, two_hundred_day_average
 546        - free_float, foreign_ratio
 547
 548        Examples:
 549            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 550            >>> stock.fast_info.market_cap
 551            370530000000
 552            >>> stock.fast_info['pe_ratio']
 553            2.8
 554            >>> stock.fast_info.keys()
 555            ['currency', 'exchange', 'timezone', ...]
 556        """
 557        if not hasattr(self, "_fast_info"):
 558            self._fast_info = FastInfo(self)
 559        return self._fast_info
 560
 561    @property
 562    def info(self) -> EnrichedInfo:
 563        """
 564        Get comprehensive ticker information with yfinance-compatible fields.
 565
 566        Returns:
 567            EnrichedInfo object providing dict-like access to:
 568
 569            Basic fields (always loaded, fast):
 570            - symbol, last, open, high, low, close, volume
 571            - change, change_percent, update_time
 572
 573            yfinance aliases (map to basic fields):
 574            - regularMarketPrice, currentPrice -> last
 575            - regularMarketOpen -> open
 576            - regularMarketDayHigh -> high
 577            - regularMarketDayLow -> low
 578            - regularMarketPreviousClose -> close
 579            - regularMarketVolume -> volume
 580
 581            Extended fields (lazy-loaded on access):
 582            - marketCap, trailingPE, priceToBook, enterpriseToEbitda
 583            - sharesOutstanding, fiftyTwoWeekHigh, fiftyTwoWeekLow
 584            - fiftyDayAverage, twoHundredDayAverage
 585            - floatShares, foreignRatio, netDebt
 586            - currency, exchange, timezone
 587
 588            Dividend fields (lazy-loaded on access):
 589            - dividendYield, exDividendDate
 590            - trailingAnnualDividendRate, trailingAnnualDividendYield
 591
 592        Examples:
 593            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 594            >>> stock.info['last']  # Basic field - fast
 595            268.5
 596            >>> stock.info['marketCap']  # Extended field - fetches Ä°ÅŸ YatÄ±rÄ±m
 597            370530000000
 598            >>> stock.info['trailingPE']  # yfinance compatible name
 599            2.8
 600            >>> stock.info.get('dividendYield')  # Safe access
 601            1.28
 602            >>> stock.info.todict()  # Get all as regular dict
 603            {...}
 604        """
 605        if not hasattr(self, "_enriched_info"):
 606            self._enriched_info = EnrichedInfo(self)
 607        return self._enriched_info
 608
 609    def history(
 610        self,
 611        period: str = "1mo",
 612        interval: str = "1d",
 613        start: datetime | str | None = None,
 614        end: datetime | str | None = None,
 615        actions: bool = False,
 616    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
 617        """
 618        Get historical OHLCV data.
 619
 620        Args:
 621            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
 622                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 2y, 5y, 10y, ytd, max.
 623                    Ignored if start is provided.
 624            interval: Data granularity. Valid intervals:
 625                      1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 1d, 1wk, 1mo.
 626            start: Start date (string or datetime).
 627            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
 628            actions: If True, include Dividends and Stock Splits columns.
 629                     Defaults to False.
 630
 631        Returns:
 632            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume.
 633            If actions=True, also includes Dividends and Stock Splits columns.
 634            Index is the Date.
 635
 636        Examples:
 637            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 638            >>> stock.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
 639            >>> stock.history(period="1y", interval="1wk")  # Weekly for 1 year
 640            >>> stock.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")  # Date range
 641            >>> stock.history(period="1y", actions=True)  # With dividends/splits
 642        """
 643        # Parse dates if strings
 644        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
 645        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
 646
 647        df = self._paratic.get_history(
 648            symbol=self._symbol,
 649            period=period,
 650            interval=interval,
 651            start=start_dt,
 652            end=end_dt,
 653        )
 654
 655        if actions and not df.empty:
 656            df = self._add_actions_to_history(df)
 657
 658        return df
 659
 660    def _add_actions_to_history(self, df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
 661        """
 662        Add Dividends and Stock Splits columns to historical data.
 663
 664        Args:
 665            df: Historical OHLCV DataFrame.
 666
 667        Returns:
 668            DataFrame with added Dividends and Stock Splits columns.
 669        """
 670        # Initialize columns with zeros
 671        df = df.copy()
 672        df["Dividends"] = 0.0
 673        df["Stock Splits"] = 0.0
 674
 675        # Get dividends
 676        try:
 677            divs = self.dividends
 678            if not divs.empty:
 679                for div_date, row in divs.iterrows():
 680                    # Normalize dates for comparison
 681                    div_date_normalized = pd.Timestamp(div_date).normalize()
 682                    for idx in df.index:
 683                        idx_normalized = pd.Timestamp(idx).normalize()
 684                        if div_date_normalized == idx_normalized:
 685                            df.loc[idx, "Dividends"] = row.get("Amount", 0)
 686                            break
 687        except Exception:
 688            pass
 689
 690        # Get stock splits (capital increases)
 691        try:
 692            splits = self.splits
 693            if not splits.empty:
 694                for split_date, row in splits.iterrows():
 695                    split_date_normalized = pd.Timestamp(split_date).normalize()
 696                    # Calculate split ratio
 697                    # BonusFromCapital + BonusFromDividend = total bonus percentage
 698                    bonus_pct = row.get("BonusFromCapital", 0) + row.get(
 699                        "BonusFromDividend", 0
 700                    )
 701                    if bonus_pct > 0:
 702                        # Convert percentage to split ratio (e.g., 20% bonus = 1.2 split)
 703                        split_ratio = 1 + (bonus_pct / 100)
 704                        for idx in df.index:
 705                            idx_normalized = pd.Timestamp(idx).normalize()
 706                            if split_date_normalized == idx_normalized:
 707                                df.loc[idx, "Stock Splits"] = split_ratio
 708                                break
 709        except Exception:
 710            pass
 711
 712        return df
 713
 714    @cached_property
 715    def dividends(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 716        """
 717        Get dividend history.
 718
 719        Returns:
 720            DataFrame with dividend history:
 721            - Amount: Dividend per share (TL)
 722            - GrossRate: Gross dividend rate (%)
 723            - NetRate: Net dividend rate (%)
 724            - TotalDividend: Total dividend distributed (TL)
 725
 726        Examples:
 727            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 728            >>> stock.dividends
 729                           Amount  GrossRate  NetRate  TotalDividend
 730            Date
 731            2025-09-02     3.442    344.20   292.57  4750000000.0
 732            2025-06-16     3.442    344.20   292.57  4750000000.0
 733        """
 734        return self._get_isyatirim().get_dividends(self._symbol)
 735
 736    @cached_property
 737    def splits(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 738        """
 739        Get capital increase (split) history.
 740
 741        Note: Turkish market uses capital increases instead of traditional splits.
 742        - RightsIssue: Paid capital increase (bedelli)
 743        - BonusFromCapital: Free shares from capital reserves (bedelsiz iÃ§ kaynak)
 744        - BonusFromDividend: Free shares from dividend (bedelsiz temettÃ¼den)
 745
 746        Returns:
 747            DataFrame with capital increase history:
 748            - Capital: New capital after increase (TL)
 749            - RightsIssue: Rights issue rate (%)
 750            - BonusFromCapital: Bonus from capital (%)
 751            - BonusFromDividend: Bonus from dividend (%)
 752
 753        Examples:
 754            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 755            >>> stock.splits
 756                             Capital  RightsIssue  BonusFromCapital  BonusFromDividend
 757            Date
 758            2013-06-26  1380000000.0         0.0             15.00               0.0
 759            2011-07-11  1200000000.0         0.0              0.00              20.0
 760        """
 761        return self._get_isyatirim().get_capital_increases(self._symbol)
 762
 763    @cached_property
 764    def actions(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 765        """
 766        Get combined dividends and splits history.
 767
 768        Returns:
 769            DataFrame with combined dividend and split actions:
 770            - Dividends: Dividend per share (TL) or 0
 771            - Splits: Combined split ratio (0 if no split)
 772
 773        Examples:
 774            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
 775            >>> stock.actions
 776                         Dividends  Splits
 777            Date
 778            2025-09-02      3.442    0.0
 779            2013-06-26      0.000   15.0
 780        """
 781        dividends = self.dividends
 782        splits = self.splits
 783
 784        # Merge on index (Date)
 785        if dividends.empty and splits.empty:
 786            return pd.DataFrame(columns=["Dividends", "Splits"])
 787
 788        # Extract relevant columns
 789        div_series = dividends["Amount"] if not dividends.empty else pd.Series(dtype=float)
 790        split_series = (
 791            splits["BonusFromCapital"] + splits["BonusFromDividend"]
 792            if not splits.empty
 793            else pd.Series(dtype=float)
 794        )
 795
 796        # Combine into single DataFrame
 797        result = pd.DataFrame({"Dividends": div_series, "Splits": split_series})
 798        result = result.fillna(0)
 799        result = result.sort_index(ascending=False)
 800
 801        return result
 802
 803    @cached_property
 804    def balance_sheet(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 805        """
 806        Get annual balance sheet data.
 807
 808        Returns:
 809            DataFrame with balance sheet items as rows and years as columns.
 810        """
 811        return self._get_isyatirim().get_financial_statements(
 812            symbol=self._symbol,
 813            statement_type="balance_sheet",
 814            quarterly=False,
 815        )

 885        )
 886
 887    def _calculate_ttm(self, quarterly_df: pd.DataFrame) -> pd.DataFrame:
 888        """
 889        Calculate trailing twelve months (TTM) by summing last 4 quarters.
 890
 891        Args:
 892            quarterly_df: DataFrame with quarterly data (columns in YYYYQN format).
 893
 894        Returns:
 895            DataFrame with single TTM column containing summed values.
 896        """
 897        if quarterly_df.empty or len(quarterly_df.columns) < 4:
 898            return pd.DataFrame(columns=["TTM"])
 899
 900        # First 4 columns = last 4 quarters (most recent first)
 901        last_4_quarters = quarterly_df.iloc[:, :4]
 902
 903        # Convert to numeric, coercing errors to NaN
 904        numeric_df = last_4_quarters.apply(pd.to_numeric, errors="coerce")
 905
 906        return numeric_df.sum(axis=1).to_frame(name="TTM")

 910        """

 913        Calculates TTM by summing the last 4 quarters of income statement data.
 914        Useful for analyzing recent performance without waiting for annual reports.
 915
 916        Returns:
 917            DataFrame with TTM column containing summed values for each line item.
 918
 919        Examples:

 923            Net SatÄ±ÅŸlar             4.5e+11
 924            BrÃ¼t Kar                 1.2e+11
 925            Faaliyet KarÄ±            8.0e+10
 926            Net Kar                  3.0e+10
 927        """
 928        return self._calculate_ttm(self.quarterly_income_stmt)

1117
1118    @cached_property
1119    def earnings_dates(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1120        """
1121        Get upcoming earnings announcement dates.
1122
1123        Derived from KAP calendar, showing expected financial report dates.
1124        Compatible with yfinance earnings_dates format.
1125
1126        Returns:
1127            DataFrame with index as Earnings Date and columns:
1128            - EPS Estimate: Always None (not available for BIST)
1129            - Reported EPS: Always None (not available for BIST)
1130            - Surprise (%): Always None (not available for BIST)
1131
1132        Examples:
1133            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
1134            >>> stock.earnings_dates
1135                            EPS Estimate  Reported EPS  Surprise(%)
1136            Earnings Date
1137            2026-03-11           None          None         None
1138            2026-05-11           None          None         None
1139        """
1140        cal = self.calendar
1141        if cal.empty:
1142            return pd.DataFrame(
1143                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1144            )
1145
1146        # Filter for financial reports only
1147        financial_reports = cal[
1148            cal["Subject"].str.contains("Finansal Rapor", case=False, na=False)
1149        ]
1150
1151        if financial_reports.empty:
1152            return pd.DataFrame(
1153                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1154            )
1155
1156        # Use EndDate as the earnings date (latest expected date)
1157        earnings_dates = []
1158        for _, row in financial_reports.iterrows():
1159            end_date = row.get("EndDate", "")
1160            if end_date:
1161                try:
1162                    # Parse Turkish date format (DD.MM.YYYY)
1163                    parsed = datetime.strptime(end_date, "%d.%m.%Y")
1164                    earnings_dates.append(parsed)
1165                except ValueError:
1166                    continue
1167
1168        if not earnings_dates:
1169            return pd.DataFrame(
1170                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1171            )
1172
1173        result = pd.DataFrame(
1174            {
1175                "EPS Estimate": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1176                "Reported EPS": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1177                "Surprise(%)": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1178            },
1179            index=pd.DatetimeIndex(earnings_dates, name="Earnings Date"),
1180        )
1181        result = result.sort_index()
1182        return result
1183
1184    def _parse_date(self, date: str | datetime) -> datetime:
1185        """Parse a date string to datetime."""
1186        if isinstance(date, datetime):
1187            return date
1188        # Try common formats
1189        for fmt in ["%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d", "%d-%m-%Y", "%d/%m/%Y"]:
1190            try:
1191                return datetime.strptime(date, fmt)
1192            except ValueError:
1193                continue
1194        raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date: {date}")
1195
1196    def __repr__(self) -> str:
1197        return f"Ticker('{self._symbol}')"

Ticker(symbol: str) 
483    def __init__(self, symbol: str):
484        """
485        Initialize a Ticker object.
486
487        Args:
488            symbol: Stock symbol (e.g., "THYAO", "GARAN", "ASELS").
489                    The ".IS" or ".E" suffix is optional and will be removed.
490        """
491        self._symbol = symbol.upper().replace(".IS", "").replace(".E", "")
492        self._paratic = get_paratic_provider()
493        self._isyatirim = None  # Lazy load for financial statements
494        self._kap = None  # Lazy load for KAP disclosures
495        self._isin_provider = None  # Lazy load for ISIN lookup
496        self._hedeffiyat = None  # Lazy load for analyst price targets

def history( self, period: str = '1mo', interval: str = '1d', start: datetime.datetime | str | None = None, end: datetime.datetime | str | None = None, actions: bool = False) -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
609    def history(
610        self,
611        period: str = "1mo",
612        interval: str = "1d",
613        start: datetime | str | None = None,
614        end: datetime | str | None = None,
615        actions: bool = False,
616    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
617        """
618        Get historical OHLCV data.
619
620        Args:
621            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
622                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 2y, 5y, 10y, ytd, max.
623                    Ignored if start is provided.
624            interval: Data granularity. Valid intervals:
625                      1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 1d, 1wk, 1mo.
626            start: Start date (string or datetime).
627            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
628            actions: If True, include Dividends and Stock Splits columns.
629                     Defaults to False.
630
631        Returns:
632            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume.
633            If actions=True, also includes Dividends and Stock Splits columns.
634            Index is the Date.
635
636        Examples:
637            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
638            >>> stock.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
639            >>> stock.history(period="1y", interval="1wk")  # Weekly for 1 year
640            >>> stock.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")  # Date range
641            >>> stock.history(period="1y", actions=True)  # With dividends/splits
642        """
643        # Parse dates if strings
644        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
645        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
646
647        df = self._paratic.get_history(
648            symbol=self._symbol,
649            period=period,
650            interval=interval,
651            start=start_dt,
652            end=end_dt,
653        )
654
655        if actions and not df.empty:
656            df = self._add_actions_to_history(df)
657
658        return df

Get historical OHLCV data.

Args: period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods: 1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 2y, 5y, 10y, ytd, max. Ignored if start is provided. interval: Data granularity. Valid intervals: 1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 1d, 1wk, 1mo. start: Start date (string or datetime). end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today. actions: If True, include Dividends and Stock Splits columns. Defaults to False.

Returns: DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume. If actions=True, also includes Dividends and Stock Splits columns. Index is the Date.

Examples:

stock = Ticker("THYAO") stock.history(period="1mo") # Last month stock.history(period="1y", interval="1wk") # Weekly for 1 year stock.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30") # Date range stock.history(period="1y", actions=True) # With dividends/splits

Get capital increase (split) history.

Note: Turkish market uses capital increases instead of traditional splits.

  • RightsIssue: Paid capital increase (bedelli)
  • BonusFromCapital: Free shares from capital reserves (bedelsiz iÃ§ kaynak)
  • BonusFromDividend: Free shares from dividend (bedelsiz temettÃ¼den)

Examples:

stock = Ticker("THYAO") stock.splits Capital RightsIssue BonusFromCapital BonusFromDividend Date 2013-06-26 1380000000.0 0.0 15.00 0.0 2011-07-11 1200000000.0 0.0 0.00 20.0

actions: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame 
763    @cached_property
764    def actions(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
765        """
766        Get combined dividends and splits history.
767
768        Returns:
769            DataFrame with combined dividend and split actions:
770            - Dividends: Dividend per share (TL) or 0
771            - Splits: Combined split ratio (0 if no split)
772
773        Examples:
774            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
775            >>> stock.actions
776                         Dividends  Splits
777            Date
778            2025-09-02      3.442    0.0
779            2013-06-26      0.000   15.0
780        """
781        dividends = self.dividends
782        splits = self.splits
783
784        # Merge on index (Date)
785        if dividends.empty and splits.empty:
786            return pd.DataFrame(columns=["Dividends", "Splits"])
787
788        # Extract relevant columns
789        div_series = dividends["Amount"] if not dividends.empty else pd.Series(dtype=float)
790        split_series = (
791            splits["BonusFromCapital"] + splits["BonusFromDividend"]
792            if not splits.empty
793            else pd.Series(dtype=float)
794        )
795
796        # Combine into single DataFrame
797        result = pd.DataFrame({"Dividends": div_series, "Splits": split_series})
798        result = result.fillna(0)
799        result = result.sort_index(ascending=False)
800
801        return result

Get combined dividends and splits history.

Returns: DataFrame with combined dividend and split actions: - Dividends: Dividend per share (TL) or 0 - Splits: Combined split ratio (0 if no split)

Examples:

stock = Ticker("THYAO") stock.actions Dividends Splits Date 2025-09-02 3.442 0.0 2013-06-26 0.000 15.0

earnings_dates: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame 
1118    @cached_property
1119    def earnings_dates(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
1120        """
1121        Get upcoming earnings announcement dates.
1122
1123        Derived from KAP calendar, showing expected financial report dates.
1124        Compatible with yfinance earnings_dates format.
1125
1126        Returns:
1127            DataFrame with index as Earnings Date and columns:
1128            - EPS Estimate: Always None (not available for BIST)
1129            - Reported EPS: Always None (not available for BIST)
1130            - Surprise (%): Always None (not available for BIST)
1131
1132        Examples:
1133            >>> stock = Ticker("THYAO")
1134            >>> stock.earnings_dates
1135                            EPS Estimate  Reported EPS  Surprise(%)
1136            Earnings Date
1137            2026-03-11           None          None         None
1138            2026-05-11           None          None         None
1139        """
1140        cal = self.calendar
1141        if cal.empty:
1142            return pd.DataFrame(
1143                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1144            )
1145
1146        # Filter for financial reports only
1147        financial_reports = cal[
1148            cal["Subject"].str.contains("Finansal Rapor", case=False, na=False)
1149        ]
1150
1151        if financial_reports.empty:
1152            return pd.DataFrame(
1153                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1154            )
1155
1156        # Use EndDate as the earnings date (latest expected date)
1157        earnings_dates = []
1158        for _, row in financial_reports.iterrows():
1159            end_date = row.get("EndDate", "")
1160            if end_date:
1161                try:
1162                    # Parse Turkish date format (DD.MM.YYYY)
1163                    parsed = datetime.strptime(end_date, "%d.%m.%Y")
1164                    earnings_dates.append(parsed)
1165                except ValueError:
1166                    continue
1167
1168        if not earnings_dates:
1169            return pd.DataFrame(
1170                columns=["EPS Estimate", "Reported EPS", "Surprise(%)"]
1171            )
1172
1173        result = pd.DataFrame(
1174            {
1175                "EPS Estimate": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1176                "Reported EPS": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1177                "Surprise(%)": [None] * len(earnings_dates),
1178            },
1179            index=pd.DatetimeIndex(earnings_dates, name="Earnings Date"),
1180        )
1181        result = result.sort_index()
1182        return result

Get upcoming earnings announcement dates.

Derived from KAP calendar, showing expected financial report dates. Compatible with yfinance earnings_dates format.

Returns: DataFrame with index as Earnings Date and columns: - EPS Estimate: Always None (not available for BIST) - Reported EPS: Always None (not available for BIST) - Surprise (%): Always None (not available for BIST)

Examples:

stock = Ticker("THYAO") stock.earnings_dates EPS Estimate Reported EPS Surprise(%) Earnings Date 2026-03-11 None None None 2026-05-11 None None None

class Tickers: 
 12class Tickers:
 13    """
 14    Container for multiple Ticker objects.
 15
 16    Examples:
 17        >>> import borsapy as bp
 18        >>> tickers = bp.Tickers("THYAO GARAN AKBNK")
 19        >>> tickers.tickers["THYAO"].info
 20        >>> tickers.symbols
 21        ['THYAO', 'GARAN', 'AKBNK']
 22
 23        >>> tickers = bp.Tickers(["THYAO", "GARAN", "AKBNK"])
 24        >>> for symbol, ticker in tickers:
 25        ...     print(symbol, ticker.info['last'])
 26    """
 27
 28    def __init__(self, symbols: str | list[str]):
 29        """
 30        Initialize Tickers with multiple symbols.
 31
 32        Args:
 33            symbols: Space-separated string or list of symbols.
 34                     Example: "THYAO GARAN AKBNK" or ["THYAO", "GARAN", "AKBNK"]
 35        """
 36        if isinstance(symbols, str):
 37            self._symbols = [s.strip().upper() for s in symbols.split() if s.strip()]
 38        else:
 39            self._symbols = [s.strip().upper() for s in symbols if s.strip()]
 40
 41        self._tickers: dict[str, Ticker] = {}
 42        for symbol in self._symbols:
 43            self._tickers[symbol] = Ticker(symbol)
 44
 45    @property
 46    def symbols(self) -> list[str]:
 47        """Return list of symbols."""
 48        return self._symbols.copy()
 49
 50    @property
 51    def tickers(self) -> dict[str, Ticker]:
 52        """Return dictionary of Ticker objects keyed by symbol."""
 53        return self._tickers
 54
 55    def history(
 56        self,
 57        period: str = "1mo",
 58        interval: str = "1d",
 59        start: datetime | str | None = None,
 60        end: datetime | str | None = None,
 61        group_by: str = "column",
 62    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
 63        """
 64        Get historical data for all tickers.
 65
 66        Args:
 67            period: Data period (1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, etc.)
 68            interval: Data interval (1d, 1wk, 1mo)
 69            start: Start date
 70            end: End date
 71            group_by: How to group columns ('column' or 'ticker')
 72
 73        Returns:
 74            DataFrame with multi-level columns.
 75        """
 76        return download(
 77            self._symbols,
 78            period=period,
 79            interval=interval,
 80            start=start,
 81            end=end,
 82            group_by=group_by,
 83        )
 84
 85    def __iter__(self):
 86        """Iterate over (symbol, ticker) pairs."""
 87        return iter(self._tickers.items())
 88
 89    def __len__(self) -> int:
 90        """Return number of tickers."""
 91        return len(self._tickers)
 92
 93    def __getitem__(self, symbol: str) -> Ticker:
 94        """Get ticker by symbol."""
 95        symbol = symbol.upper()
 96        if symbol not in self._tickers:
 97            raise KeyError(f"Symbol not found: {symbol}")
 98        return self._tickers[symbol]
 99
100    def __repr__(self) -> str:
101        return f"Tickers({self._symbols})"

Container for multiple Ticker objects.

Examples:

import borsapy as bp tickers = bp.Tickers("THYAO GARAN AKBNK") tickers.tickers["THYAO"].info tickers.symbols ['THYAO', 'GARAN', 'AKBNK']

>>> tickers = bp.Tickers(["THYAO", "GARAN", "AKBNK"])
>>> for symbol, ticker in tickers:
...     print(symbol, ticker.info['last'])

def history( self, period: str = '1mo', interval: str = '1d', start: datetime.datetime | str | None = None, end: datetime.datetime | str | None = None, group_by: str = 'column') -> pandas.core.frame.DataFrame: 
55    def history(
56        self,
57        period: str = "1mo",
58        interval: str = "1d",

66        Args:

68            interval: Data interval (1d, 1wk, 1mo)
69            start: Start date
70            end: End date
71            group_by: How to group columns ('column' or 'ticker')
72
73        Returns:
74            DataFrame with multi-level columns.
75        """
76        return download(
77            self._symbols,
78            period=period,
79            interval=interval,
80            start=start,
81            end=end,
82            group_by=group_by,
83        )

Get historical data for all tickers.

Args: period: Data period (1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, etc.) interval: Data interval (1d, 1wk, 1mo) start: Start date end: End date group_by: How to group columns ('column' or 'ticker')

Returns: DataFrame with multi-level columns.

218    def history(
219        self,
220        period: str = "1mo",
221        start: datetime | str | None = None,
222        end: datetime | str | None = None,
223    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
224        """
225        Get historical OHLC data.
226
227        Args:
228            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
229                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y.
230                    Ignored if start is provided.
231            start: Start date (string or datetime).
232            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
233
234        Returns:
235            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close.
236            Index is the Date.
237
238        Examples:
239            >>> fx = FX("USD")
240            >>> fx.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
241            >>> fx.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")  # Date range
242        """
243        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
244        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
245
246        return self._provider.get_history(
247            asset=self._asset,
248            period=period,
249            start=start_dt,
250            end=end_dt,
251        )

253    def institution_history(
254        self,
255        institution: str,
256        period: str = "1mo",
257        start: datetime | str | None = None,
258        end: datetime | str | None = None,
259    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
260        """
261        Get historical OHLC data from a specific institution.
262
263        Supports both precious metals and currencies.
264
265        Args:
266            institution: Institution slug (akbank, kapalicarsi, harem, etc.)
267            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
268                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y.
269                    Ignored if start is provided.
270            start: Start date (string or datetime).
271            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
272
273        Returns:
274            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close.
275            Index is the Date.
276            Note: Banks typically return only Close values (Open/High/Low = 0).
277
278        Examples:
279            >>> # Metal history
280            >>> gold = FX("gram-altin")

282            >>> gold.institution_history("kapalicarsi", start="2024-01-01")

284            >>> # Currency history
285            >>> usd = FX("USD")
286            >>> usd.institution_history("akbank", period="1mo")
287            >>> usd.institution_history("garanti-bbva", period="5d")
288        """
289        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
290        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
291
292        return self._provider.get_institution_history(
293            asset=self._asset,
294            institution=institution,
295            period=period,
296            start=start_dt,
297            end=end_dt,
298        )
299
300    def _parse_date(self, date: str | datetime) -> datetime:
301        """Parse a date string to datetime."""
302        if isinstance(date, datetime):
303            return date
304        for fmt in ["%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d", "%d-%m-%Y", "%d/%m/%Y"]:
305            try:
306                return datetime.strptime(date, fmt)
307            except ValueError:
308                continue
309        raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date: {date}")
310
311    def __repr__(self) -> str:
312        return f"FX('{self._asset}')"

class Crypto: 
 12class Crypto:
 13    """
 14    A yfinance-like interface for cryptocurrency data from BtcTurk.
 15
 16    Examples:
 17        >>> import borsapy as bp
 18        >>> btc = bp.Crypto("BTCTRY")
 19        >>> btc.current
 20        {'symbol': 'BTCTRY', 'last': 3500000.0, ...}
 21        >>> btc.history(period="1mo")
 22                             Open       High        Low      Close      Volume
 23        Date
 24        2024-12-01   3400000.0  3550000.0  3380000.0  3500000.0   1234.5678
 25        ...
 26
 27        >>> eth = bp.Crypto("ETHTRY")
 28        >>> eth.current['last']
 29        125000.0
 30    """
 31
 32    def __init__(self, pair: str):
 33        """
 34        Initialize a Crypto object.
 35
 36        Args:
 37            pair: Trading pair (e.g., "BTCTRY", "ETHTRY", "BTCUSDT").
 38                  Common pairs: BTCTRY, ETHTRY, XRPTRY, DOGETRY, SOLTRY
 39        """
 40        self._pair = pair.upper()
 41        self._provider = get_btcturk_provider()
 42        self._current_cache: dict[str, Any] | None = None
 43
 44    @property
 45    def pair(self) -> str:
 46        """Return the trading pair."""
 47        return self._pair
 48
 49    @property
 50    def symbol(self) -> str:
 51        """Return the trading pair (alias)."""
 52        return self._pair
 53
 54    @property
 55    def current(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
 56        """
 57        Get current ticker information.
 58
 59        Returns:
 60            Dictionary with current market data:
 61            - symbol: Trading pair
 62            - last: Last traded price
 63            - open: Opening price
 64            - high: 24h high
 65            - low: 24h low
 66            - bid: Best bid price
 67            - ask: Best ask price
 68            - volume: 24h volume
 69            - change: Price change
 70            - change_percent: Percent change
 71        """
 72        if self._current_cache is None:
 73            self._current_cache = self._provider.get_ticker(self._pair)
 74        return self._current_cache
 75
 76    @property
 77    def info(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
 78        """Alias for current property (yfinance compatibility)."""
 79        return self.current
 80
 81    def history(
 82        self,

 84        interval: str = "1d",

 86        end: datetime | str | None = None,
 87    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
 88        """
 89        Get historical OHLCV data.
 90
 91        Args:
 92            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
 93                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y.
 94                    Ignored if start is provided.
 95            interval: Data granularity. Valid intervals:
 96                      1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 4h, 1d, 1wk.
 97            start: Start date (string or datetime).
 98            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to now.
 99
100        Returns:
101            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume.
102            Index is the Date.
103
104        Examples:
105            >>> crypto = Crypto("BTCTRY")
106            >>> crypto.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
107            >>> crypto.history(period="1y", interval="1wk")  # Weekly for 1 year
108            >>> crypto.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")  # Date range
109        """
110        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
111        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
112
113        return self._provider.get_history(
114            pair=self._pair,
115            period=period,
116            interval=interval,
117            start=start_dt,
118            end=end_dt,
119        )

121    def _parse_date(self, date: str | datetime) -> datetime:
122        """Parse a date string to datetime."""
123        if isinstance(date, datetime):
124            return date
125        for fmt in ["%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d", "%d-%m-%Y", "%d/%m/%Y"]:
126            try:
127                return datetime.strptime(date, fmt)
128            except ValueError:
129                continue
130        raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date: {date}")

 15    A yfinance-like interface for mutual fund data from TEFAS.

 18        >>> import borsapy as bp

 26        ...

 29        >>> fund.info['return_1y']

 38            fund_code: TEFAS fund code (e.g., "AAK", "TTE", "YAF")

 56        """
 57        Get detailed fund information.
 58
 59        Returns:
 60            Dictionary with fund details:
 61            - fund_code: TEFAS fund code
 62            - name: Fund full name
 63            - date: Last update date
 64            - price: Current unit price
 65            - fund_size: Total fund size (TRY)
 66            - investor_count: Number of investors
 67            - founder: Fund founder company
 68            - manager: Fund manager company
 69            - fund_type: Fund type
 70            - category: Fund category
 71            - risk_value: Risk rating (1-7)
 72            - return_1m, return_3m, return_6m: Period returns
 73            - return_ytd: Year-to-date return
 74            - return_1y, return_3y, return_5y: Annual returns
 75            - daily_return: Daily return
 76        """
 77        if self._info_cache is None:
 78            self._info_cache = self._provider.get_fund_detail(self._fund_code)
 79        return self._info_cache

 86    @property
 87    def performance(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
 88        """
 89        Get fund performance metrics only.

 91        Returns:
 92            Dictionary with performance data:

110    @property
111    def allocation(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
112        """
113        Get current portfolio allocation (asset breakdown) for last 7 days.
114
115        For longer periods, use allocation_history() method.
116
117        Returns:
118            DataFrame with columns: Date, asset_type, asset_name, weight.
119
120        Examples:
121            >>> fund = Fund("AAK")
122            >>> fund.allocation
123                             Date asset_type         asset_name  weight
124            0 2024-12-20         HS        Hisse Senedi   45.32
125            1 2024-12-20         DB        Devlet Bonusu  30.15
126            ...
127        """
128        return self._provider.get_allocation(self._fund_code)
129
130    def allocation_history(
131        self,
132        period: str = "1mo",
133        start: datetime | str | None = None,
134        end: datetime | str | None = None,
135    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
136        """
137        Get historical portfolio allocation (asset breakdown).
138
139        Note: TEFAS API supports maximum ~100 days (3 months) of data.
140
141        Args:
142            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
143                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo (max ~100 days).
144                    Ignored if start is provided.
145            start: Start date (string or datetime).
146            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
147
148        Returns:
149            DataFrame with columns: Date, asset_type, asset_name, weight.
150
151        Examples:
152            >>> fund = Fund("AAK")
153            >>> fund.allocation_history(period="1mo")  # Last month
154            >>> fund.allocation_history(period="3mo")  # Last 3 months (max)
155            >>> fund.allocation_history(start="2024-10-01", end="2024-12-31")
156        """
157        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
158        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
159
160        # If no start date, calculate from period
161        if start_dt is None:
162            from datetime import timedelta
163            end_dt = end_dt or datetime.now()
164            days = {"1d": 1, "5d": 5, "1mo": 30, "3mo": 90}.get(period, 30)
165            # Cap at 100 days (API limit)
166            days = min(days, 100)
167            start_dt = end_dt - timedelta(days=days)
168
169        return self._provider.get_allocation(
170            fund_code=self._fund_code,
171            start=start_dt,
172            end=end_dt,
173        )

175    def history(
176        self,
177        period: str = "1mo",
178        start: datetime | str | None = None,
179        end: datetime | str | None = None,
180    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
181        """
182        Get historical price data.
183
184        Args:
185            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
186                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y.
187                    Ignored if start is provided.
188            start: Start date (string or datetime).
189            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to now.
190
191        Returns:
192            DataFrame with columns: Price, FundSize, Investors.
193            Index is the Date.
194
195        Examples:
196            >>> fund = Fund("AAK")
197            >>> fund.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
198            >>> fund.history(period="1y")  # Last year
199            >>> fund.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")  # Date range
200        """
201        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
202        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
203
204        return self._provider.get_history(
205            fund_code=self._fund_code,
206            period=period,
207            start=start_dt,
208            end=end_dt,
209        )

211    def _parse_date(self, date: str | datetime) -> datetime:
212        """Parse a date string to datetime."""
213        if isinstance(date, datetime):
214            return date
215        for fmt in ["%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d", "%d-%m-%Y", "%d/%m/%Y"]:
216            try:
217                return datetime.strptime(date, fmt)
218            except ValueError:
219                continue
220        raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date: {date}")
221
222    def sharpe_ratio(self, period: str = "1y", risk_free_rate: float | None = None) -> float:
223        """
224        Calculate the Sharpe ratio for the fund.
225
226        Sharpe Ratio = (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp
227        Where:
228        - Rp = Annualized return of the fund
229        - Rf = Risk-free rate (default: 10Y government bond yield)
230        - Ïƒp = Annualized standard deviation of returns
231
232        Args:
233            period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y".
234            risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%).
235                           If None, uses current 10Y bond yield from bp.risk_free_rate().
236
237        Returns:
238            Sharpe ratio as float. Higher is better (>1 good, >2 very good, >3 excellent).
239
240        Examples:
241            >>> fund = bp.Fund("YAY")
242            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio()  # 1-year Sharpe with current risk-free rate
243            0.85
244
245            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio(period="3y")  # 3-year Sharpe
246            1.23
247
248            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio(risk_free_rate=0.25)  # Custom risk-free rate
249            0.92
250        """
251        metrics = self.risk_metrics(period=period, risk_free_rate=risk_free_rate)
252        return metrics.get("sharpe_ratio", np.nan)
253
254    def risk_metrics(
255        self,
256        period: str = "1y",
257        risk_free_rate: float | None = None,
258    ) -> dict[str, Any]:
259        """
260        Calculate comprehensive risk metrics for the fund.
261
262        Args:
263            period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y".
264            risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%).
265                           If None, uses current 10Y bond yield.
266
267        Returns:
268            Dictionary with risk metrics:
269            - annualized_return: Annualized return (%)
270            - annualized_volatility: Annualized standard deviation (%)
271            - sharpe_ratio: Risk-adjusted return (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp
272            - sortino_ratio: Downside risk-adjusted return
273            - max_drawdown: Maximum peak-to-trough decline (%)
274            - risk_free_rate: Risk-free rate used (%)
275            - trading_days: Number of trading days in the period
276
277        Examples:
278            >>> fund = bp.Fund("YAY")
279            >>> metrics = fund.risk_metrics()
280            >>> print(f"Sharpe: {metrics['sharpe_ratio']:.2f}")
281            >>> print(f"Max Drawdown: {metrics['max_drawdown']:.1f}%")
282        """
283        # Get historical data
284        df = self.history(period=period)
285
286        if df.empty or len(df) < 20:
287            return {
288                "annualized_return": np.nan,
289                "annualized_volatility": np.nan,
290                "sharpe_ratio": np.nan,
291                "sortino_ratio": np.nan,
292                "max_drawdown": np.nan,
293                "risk_free_rate": np.nan,
294                "trading_days": 0,
295            }
296
297        # Calculate daily returns
298        prices = df["Price"]
299        daily_returns = prices.pct_change().dropna()
300        trading_days = len(daily_returns)
301
302        # Annualization factor (trading days per year)
303        annualization_factor = 252
304
305        # Annualized return
306        total_return = (prices.iloc[-1] / prices.iloc[0]) - 1
307        years = trading_days / annualization_factor
308        annualized_return = ((1 + total_return) ** (1 / years) - 1) * 100
309
310        # Annualized volatility
311        daily_volatility = daily_returns.std()
312        annualized_volatility = daily_volatility * np.sqrt(annualization_factor) * 100
313
314        # Get risk-free rate
315        if risk_free_rate is None:
316            try:
317                from borsapy.bond import risk_free_rate as get_rf_rate
318                rf = get_rf_rate() * 100  # Returns decimal like 0.28, convert to %
319            except Exception:
320                rf = 30.0  # Fallback: approximate Turkish 10Y yield
321        else:
322            rf = risk_free_rate * 100  # Convert decimal to percentage
323
324        # Sharpe Ratio
325        if annualized_volatility > 0:
326            sharpe = (annualized_return - rf) / annualized_volatility
327        else:
328            sharpe = np.nan
329
330        # Sortino Ratio (uses downside deviation)
331        negative_returns = daily_returns[daily_returns < 0]
332        if len(negative_returns) > 0:
333            downside_deviation = negative_returns.std() * np.sqrt(annualization_factor) * 100
334            if downside_deviation > 0:
335                sortino = (annualized_return - rf) / downside_deviation
336            else:
337                sortino = np.nan
338        else:
339            sortino = np.inf  # No negative returns
340
341        # Maximum Drawdown
342        cumulative = (1 + daily_returns).cumprod()
343        running_max = cumulative.cummax()
344        drawdowns = (cumulative - running_max) / running_max
345        max_drawdown = drawdowns.min() * 100  # Negative percentage
346
347        return {
348            "annualized_return": round(annualized_return, 2),
349            "annualized_volatility": round(annualized_volatility, 2),
350            "sharpe_ratio": round(sharpe, 2) if not np.isnan(sharpe) else np.nan,
351            "sortino_ratio": round(sortino, 2) if not np.isnan(sortino) and not np.isinf(sortino) else sortino,
352            "max_drawdown": round(max_drawdown, 2),
353            "risk_free_rate": round(rf, 2),
354            "trading_days": trading_days,
355        }
356
357    def __repr__(self) -> str:
358        return f"Fund('{self._fund_code}')"

131        self,
132        period: str = "1mo",
133        start: datetime | str | None = None,
134        end: datetime | str | None = None,
135    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
136        """
137        Get historical portfolio allocation (asset breakdown).
138
139        Note: TEFAS API supports maximum ~100 days (3 months) of data.
140
141        Args:
142            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
143                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo (max ~100 days).
144                    Ignored if start is provided.
145            start: Start date (string or datetime).
146            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
147
148        Returns:
149            DataFrame with columns: Date, asset_type, asset_name, weight.
150
151        Examples:
152            >>> fund = Fund("AAK")
153            >>> fund.allocation_history(period="1mo")  # Last month
154            >>> fund.allocation_history(period="3mo")  # Last 3 months (max)
155            >>> fund.allocation_history(start="2024-10-01", end="2024-12-31")
156        """
157        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
158        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
159
160        # If no start date, calculate from period
161        if start_dt is None:
162            from datetime import timedelta
163            end_dt = end_dt or datetime.now()
164            days = {"1d": 1, "5d": 5, "1mo": 30, "3mo": 90}.get(period, 30)
165            # Cap at 100 days (API limit)
166            days = min(days, 100)
167            start_dt = end_dt - timedelta(days=days)
168
169        return self._provider.get_allocation(
170            fund_code=self._fund_code,
171            start=start_dt,
172            end=end_dt,
173        )

Args: period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods: 1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo (max ~100 days). Ignored if start is provided. start: Start date (string or datetime). end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.

Returns: DataFrame with columns: Date, asset_type, asset_name, weight.

def sharpe_ratio(self, period: str = '1y', risk_free_rate: float | None = None) -> float: 
222    def sharpe_ratio(self, period: str = "1y", risk_free_rate: float | None = None) -> float:
223        """
224        Calculate the Sharpe ratio for the fund.
225
226        Sharpe Ratio = (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp
227        Where:
228        - Rp = Annualized return of the fund
229        - Rf = Risk-free rate (default: 10Y government bond yield)
230        - Ïƒp = Annualized standard deviation of returns
231
232        Args:
233            period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y".
234            risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%).
235                           If None, uses current 10Y bond yield from bp.risk_free_rate().
236
237        Returns:
238            Sharpe ratio as float. Higher is better (>1 good, >2 very good, >3 excellent).
239
240        Examples:
241            >>> fund = bp.Fund("YAY")
242            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio()  # 1-year Sharpe with current risk-free rate
243            0.85
244
245            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio(period="3y")  # 3-year Sharpe
246            1.23
247
248            >>> fund.sharpe_ratio(risk_free_rate=0.25)  # Custom risk-free rate
249            0.92
250        """
251        metrics = self.risk_metrics(period=period, risk_free_rate=risk_free_rate)
252        return metrics.get("sharpe_ratio", np.nan)

Calculate the Sharpe ratio for the fund.

Sharpe Ratio = (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp Where:

  • Rp = Annualized return of the fund
  • Rf = Risk-free rate (default: 10Y government bond yield)
  • Ïƒp = Annualized standard deviation of returns

Args: period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y". risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%). If None, uses current 10Y bond yield from bp.risk_free_rate().

Returns: Sharpe ratio as float. Higher is better (>1 good, >2 very good, >3 excellent).

Examples:

fund = bp.Fund("YAY") fund.sharpe_ratio() # 1-year Sharpe with current risk-free rate 0.85

>>> fund.sharpe_ratio(period="3y")  # 3-year Sharpe
1.23

>>> fund.sharpe_ratio(risk_free_rate=0.25)  # Custom risk-free rate
0.92
def risk_metrics( self, period: str = '1y', risk_free_rate: float | None = None) -> dict[str, typing.Any]: 
254    def risk_metrics(
255        self,
256        period: str = "1y",
257        risk_free_rate: float | None = None,
258    ) -> dict[str, Any]:
259        """
260        Calculate comprehensive risk metrics for the fund.
261
262        Args:
263            period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y".
264            risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%).
265                           If None, uses current 10Y bond yield.
266
267        Returns:
268            Dictionary with risk metrics:
269            - annualized_return: Annualized return (%)
270            - annualized_volatility: Annualized standard deviation (%)
271            - sharpe_ratio: Risk-adjusted return (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp
272            - sortino_ratio: Downside risk-adjusted return
273            - max_drawdown: Maximum peak-to-trough decline (%)
274            - risk_free_rate: Risk-free rate used (%)
275            - trading_days: Number of trading days in the period
276
277        Examples:
278            >>> fund = bp.Fund("YAY")
279            >>> metrics = fund.risk_metrics()
280            >>> print(f"Sharpe: {metrics['sharpe_ratio']:.2f}")
281            >>> print(f"Max Drawdown: {metrics['max_drawdown']:.1f}%")
282        """
283        # Get historical data
284        df = self.history(period=period)
285
286        if df.empty or len(df) < 20:
287            return {
288                "annualized_return": np.nan,
289                "annualized_volatility": np.nan,
290                "sharpe_ratio": np.nan,
291                "sortino_ratio": np.nan,
292                "max_drawdown": np.nan,
293                "risk_free_rate": np.nan,
294                "trading_days": 0,
295            }
296
297        # Calculate daily returns
298        prices = df["Price"]
299        daily_returns = prices.pct_change().dropna()
300        trading_days = len(daily_returns)
301
302        # Annualization factor (trading days per year)
303        annualization_factor = 252
304
305        # Annualized return
306        total_return = (prices.iloc[-1] / prices.iloc[0]) - 1
307        years = trading_days / annualization_factor
308        annualized_return = ((1 + total_return) ** (1 / years) - 1) * 100
309
310        # Annualized volatility
311        daily_volatility = daily_returns.std()
312        annualized_volatility = daily_volatility * np.sqrt(annualization_factor) * 100
313
314        # Get risk-free rate
315        if risk_free_rate is None:
316            try:
317                from borsapy.bond import risk_free_rate as get_rf_rate
318                rf = get_rf_rate() * 100  # Returns decimal like 0.28, convert to %
319            except Exception:
320                rf = 30.0  # Fallback: approximate Turkish 10Y yield
321        else:
322            rf = risk_free_rate * 100  # Convert decimal to percentage
323
324        # Sharpe Ratio
325        if annualized_volatility > 0:
326            sharpe = (annualized_return - rf) / annualized_volatility
327        else:
328            sharpe = np.nan
329
330        # Sortino Ratio (uses downside deviation)
331        negative_returns = daily_returns[daily_returns < 0]
332        if len(negative_returns) > 0:
333            downside_deviation = negative_returns.std() * np.sqrt(annualization_factor) * 100
334            if downside_deviation > 0:
335                sortino = (annualized_return - rf) / downside_deviation
336            else:
337                sortino = np.nan
338        else:
339            sortino = np.inf  # No negative returns
340
341        # Maximum Drawdown
342        cumulative = (1 + daily_returns).cumprod()
343        running_max = cumulative.cummax()
344        drawdowns = (cumulative - running_max) / running_max
345        max_drawdown = drawdowns.min() * 100  # Negative percentage
346
347        return {
348            "annualized_return": round(annualized_return, 2),
349            "annualized_volatility": round(annualized_volatility, 2),
350            "sharpe_ratio": round(sharpe, 2) if not np.isnan(sharpe) else np.nan,
351            "sortino_ratio": round(sortino, 2) if not np.isnan(sortino) and not np.isinf(sortino) else sortino,
352            "max_drawdown": round(max_drawdown, 2),
353            "risk_free_rate": round(rf, 2),
354            "trading_days": trading_days,
355        }

Calculate comprehensive risk metrics for the fund.

Args: period: Period for calculation ("1y", "3y", "5y"). Default is "1y". risk_free_rate: Annual risk-free rate as decimal (e.g., 0.28 for 28%). If None, uses current 10Y bond yield.

Returns: Dictionary with risk metrics: - annualized_return: Annualized return (%) - annualized_volatility: Annualized standard deviation (%) - sharpe_ratio: Risk-adjusted return (Rp - Rf) / Ïƒp - sortino_ratio: Downside risk-adjusted return - max_drawdown: Maximum peak-to-trough decline (%) - risk_free_rate: Risk-free rate used (%) - trading_days: Number of trading days in the period

Examples:

fund = bp.Fund("YAY") metrics = fund.risk_metrics() print(f"Sharpe: {metrics['sharpe_ratio']:.2f}") print(f"Max Drawdown: {metrics['max_drawdown']:.1f}%")

class Index: 
 54class Index:
 55    """
 56    A yfinance-like interface for Turkish market indices.
 57
 58    Examples:
 59        >>> import borsapy as bp
 60        >>> xu100 = bp.Index("XU100")
 61        >>> xu100.info
 62        {'symbol': 'XU100', 'name': 'BIST 100', 'last': 9500.5, ...}
 63        >>> xu100.history(period="1mo")
 64                         Open      High       Low     Close      Volume
 65        Date
 66        2024-12-01    9400.00  9550.00  9380.00  9500.50  1234567890
 67        ...
 68
 69        # Available indices
 70        >>> bp.indices()
 71        ['XU100', 'XU050', 'XU030', 'XBANK', ...]
 72    """
 73
 74    def __init__(self, symbol: str):
 75        """
 76        Initialize an Index object.
 77
 78        Args:
 79            symbol: Index symbol (e.g., "XU100", "XU030", "XBANK").
 80        """
 81        self._symbol = symbol.upper()
 82        self._paratic = get_paratic_provider()
 83        self._bist_index = get_bist_index_provider()
 84        self._info_cache: dict[str, Any] | None = None
 85        self._components_cache: list[dict[str, Any]] | None = None
 86
 87    @property
 88    def symbol(self) -> str:
 89        """Return the index symbol."""
 90        return self._symbol
 91
 92    @property
 93    def info(self) -> dict[str, Any]:
 94        """
 95        Get current index information.
 96
 97        Returns:
 98            Dictionary with index data:
 99            - symbol: Index symbol
100            - name: Index full name
101            - last: Current value
102            - open: Opening value
103            - high: Day high
104            - low: Day low
105            - close: Previous close
106            - change: Value change
107            - change_percent: Percent change
108            - update_time: Last update timestamp
109        """
110        if self._info_cache is None:
111            # Use Paratic API to get quote (same endpoint works for indices)
112            quote = self._paratic.get_quote(self._symbol)
113            quote["name"] = INDICES.get(self._symbol, self._symbol)
114            quote["type"] = "index"
115            self._info_cache = quote
116        return self._info_cache
117
118    @property
119    def components(self) -> list[dict[str, Any]]:
120        """
121        Get constituent stocks of this index.
122
123        Returns:
124            List of component dicts with 'symbol' and 'name' keys.
125            Empty list if index components are not available.
126
127        Examples:
128            >>> import borsapy as bp
129            >>> xu030 = bp.Index("XU030")
130            >>> xu030.components
131            [{'symbol': 'AKBNK', 'name': 'AKBANK'}, ...]
132            >>> len(xu030.components)
133            30
134        """
135        if self._components_cache is None:
136            self._components_cache = self._bist_index.get_components(self._symbol)
137        return self._components_cache
138
139    @property
140    def component_symbols(self) -> list[str]:
141        """
142        Get just the ticker symbols of constituent stocks.
143
144        Returns:
145            List of stock symbols.
146
147        Examples:
148            >>> import borsapy as bp
149            >>> xu030 = bp.Index("XU030")
150            >>> xu030.component_symbols
151            ['AKBNK', 'AKSA', 'AKSEN', ...]
152        """
153        return [c["symbol"] for c in self.components]
154
155    def history(
156        self,
157        period: str = "1mo",
158        interval: str = "1d",
159        start: datetime | str | None = None,
160        end: datetime | str | None = None,
161    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
162        """
163        Get historical index data.
164
165        Args:
166            period: How much data to fetch. Valid periods:
167                    1d, 5d, 1mo, 3mo, 6mo, 1y, 2y, 5y, ytd, max.
168                    Ignored if start is provided.
169            interval: Data interval. Valid intervals:
170                      1m, 5m, 15m, 30m, 1h, 1d, 1wk, 1mo.
171            start: Start date (string or datetime).
172            end: End date (string or datetime). Defaults to today.
173
174        Returns:
175            DataFrame with columns: Open, High, Low, Close, Volume.
176            Index is the Date.
177
178        Examples:
179            >>> idx = Index("XU100")
180            >>> idx.history(period="1mo")  # Last month
181            >>> idx.history(period="1y")  # Last year
182            >>> idx.history(start="2024-01-01", end="2024-06-30")
183        """
184        # Parse dates
185        start_dt = self._parse_date(start) if start else None
186        end_dt = self._parse_date(end) if end else None
187
188        # Use Paratic provider (same API works for indices)
189        return self._paratic.get_history(
190            symbol=self._symbol,
191            period=period,
192            interval=interval,
193            start=start_dt,
194            end=end_dt,
195        )
196
197    def _parse_date(self, date: str | datetime) -> datetime:
198        """Parse a date string to datetime."""
199        if isinstance(date, datetime):
200            return date
201        for fmt in ["%Y-%m-%d", "%Y/%m/%d", "%d-%m-%Y", "%d/%m/%Y"]:
202            try:
203                return datetime.strptime(date, fmt)
204            except ValueError:
205                continue
206        raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date: {date}")
207
208    def __repr__(self) -> str:
209        return f"Index('{self._symbol}')"

class Inflation: 
 11class Inflation:
 12    """
 13    A yfinance-like interface for Turkish inflation data from TCMB.
 14
 15    Examples:
 16        >>> import borsapy as bp
 17        >>> inf = bp.Inflation()
 18
 19        # Get latest inflation
 20        >>> inf.latest()
 21        {'date': '2024-11-01', 'yearly_inflation': 47.09, 'monthly_inflation': 2.24, ...}
 22
 23        # Get TÃœFE history
 24        >>> inf.tufe(limit=12)  # Last 12 months
 25                        YearMonth  YearlyInflation  MonthlyInflation
 26        Date
 27        2024-11-01      11-2024             47.09              2.24
 28        ...
 29
 30        # Calculate inflation
 31        >>> inf.calculate(100000, "2020-01", "2024-01")
 32        {'initial_value': 100000, 'final_value': 342515.0, 'total_change': 242.52, ...}
 33    """
 34
 35    def __init__(self):
 36        """Initialize an Inflation object."""
 37        self._provider = get_tcmb_provider()
 38
 39    def latest(self, inflation_type: str = "tufe") -> dict[str, Any]:
 40        """
 41        Get the latest inflation data.
 42
 43        Args:
 44            inflation_type: 'tufe' (CPI) or 'ufe' (PPI)
 45
 46        Returns:
 47            Dictionary with latest inflation data:
 48            - date: Date string (YYYY-MM-DD)
 49            - year_month: Month-Year string
 50            - yearly_inflation: Year-over-year inflation rate
 51            - monthly_inflation: Month-over-month inflation rate
 52            - type: Inflation type (TUFE or UFE)
 53        """
 54        return self._provider.get_latest(inflation_type)
 55
 56    def tufe(
 57        self,
 58        start: str | None = None,
 59        end: str | None = None,
 60        limit: int | None = None,
 61    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
 62        """
 63        Get TÃœFE (Consumer Price Index) data.
 64
 65        Args:
 66            start: Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
 67            end: End date in YYYY-MM-DD format
 68            limit: Maximum number of records
 69
 70        Returns:
 71            DataFrame with columns: YearMonth, YearlyInflation, MonthlyInflation.
 72            Index is the Date.
 73
 74        Examples:
 75            >>> inf = Inflation()
 76            >>> inf.tufe(limit=6)  # Last 6 months
 77            >>> inf.tufe(start="2023-01-01", end="2023-12-31")  # 2023 data
 78        """
 79        return self._provider.get_data("tufe", start, end, limit)
 80
 81    def ufe(
 82        self,
 83        start: str | None = None,
 84        end: str | None = None,
 85        limit: int | None = None,
 86    ) -> pd.DataFrame:
 87        """
 88        Get ÃœFE (Producer Price Index) data.
 89
 90        Args:
 91            start: Start date in YYYY-MM-DD format
 92            end: End date in YYYY-MM-DD format
 93            limit: Maximum number of records

102            >>> inf.ufe(start="2023-01-01", end="2023-12-31")  # 2023 data

106    def calculate(
107        self,
108        amount: float,
109        start: str,
110        end: str,
111    ) -> dict[str, Any]:
112        """
113        Calculate inflation-adjusted value between two dates.
114
115        Uses TCMB's official inflation calculator API.
116
117        Args:
118            amount: Initial amount in TRY
119            start: Start date in YYYY-MM format (e.g., "2020-01")
120            end: End date in YYYY-MM format (e.g., "2024-01")
121
122        Returns:
123            Dictionary with:
124            - start_date: Start date
125            - end_date: End date
126            - initial_value: Initial amount
127            - final_value: Inflation-adjusted value
128            - total_years: Total years elapsed
129            - total_months: Total months elapsed
130            - total_change: Total percentage change
131            - avg_yearly_inflation: Average yearly inflation rate
132            - start_cpi: CPI at start date
133            - end_cpi: CPI at end date
134
135        Examples:
136            >>> inf = Inflation()
137            >>> result = inf.calculate(100000, "2020-01", "2024-01")
138            >>> print(f"100,000 TL in 2020 = {result['final_value']:,.0f} TL in 2024")
139            100,000 TL in 2020 = 342,515 TL in 2024
140        """
141        start_year, start_month = self._parse_year_month(start)
142        end_year, end_month = self._parse_year_month(end)
143
144        return self._provider.calculate_inflation(
145            start_year=start_year,
146            start_month=start_month,
147            end_year=end_year,
148            end_month=end_month,
149            basket_value=amount,
150        )
151
152    def _parse_year_month(self, date_str: str) -> tuple[int, int]:
153        """Parse YYYY-MM format to (year, month) tuple."""
154        try:
155            parts = date_str.split("-")
156            if len(parts) != 2:
157                raise ValueError(f"Invalid date format: {date_str}. Use YYYY-MM")
158            year = int(parts[0])
159            month = int(parts[1])
160            if not (1 <= month <= 12):
161                raise ValueError(f"Invalid month: {month}")
162            return year, month
163        except Exception as e:
164            raise ValueError(f"Could not parse date '{date_str}': {e}") from e
165
166    def __repr__(self) -> str:
167        return "Inflation()"

class VIOP: 
 13class VIOP:
 14    """
 15    VÄ°OP (Vadeli Ä°ÅŸlem ve Opsiyon PiyasasÄ±) data access.
 16
 17    Provides access to Turkish derivatives market data including
 18    futures and options contracts.
 19
 20    Data source: Ä°ÅŸ YatÄ±rÄ±m (HTML scraping)
 21    Note: Data is delayed by ~15 minutes
 22
 23    Examples:
 24        >>> from borsapy import VIOP
 25        >>> viop = VIOP()
 26        >>> viop.futures  # All futures contracts
 27        >>> viop.stock_futures  # Stock futures only
 28        >>> viop.options  # All options contracts
 29    """
 30
 31    def __init__(self) -> None:
 32        """Initialize VÄ°OP data accessor."""
 33        self._provider = get_viop_provider()
 34
 35    @cached_property
 36    def futures(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 37        """
 38        Get all futures contracts.
 39
 40        Returns:
 41            DataFrame with columns:
 42                - code: Contract code (e.g., F_AKBNK0226)
 43                - contract: Contract name (e.g., AKBNK Åžubat 2026 Vadeli)
 44                - price: Last price
 45                - change: Price change
 46                - volume_tl: Trading volume in TL
 47                - volume_qty: Trading volume in contracts
 48                - category: stock, index, currency, or commodity
 49        """
 50        return self._provider.get_futures("all")
 51
 52    @cached_property
 53    def stock_futures(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 54        """
 55        Get stock futures contracts (Pay Vadeli Ä°ÅŸlem).
 56
 57        Returns:
 58            DataFrame with futures on individual stocks.
 59        """
 60        return self._provider.get_futures("stock")
 61
 62    @cached_property
 63    def index_futures(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 64        """
 65        Get index futures contracts (Endeks Vadeli Ä°ÅŸlem).
 66
 67        Includes XU030, XLBNK, etc.
 68
 69        Returns:
 70            DataFrame with index futures.
 71        """
 72        return self._provider.get_futures("index")
 73
 74    @cached_property
 75    def currency_futures(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 76        """
 77        Get currency futures contracts (DÃ¶viz Vadeli Ä°ÅŸlem).
 78
 79        Includes USD/TRY, EUR/TRY, etc.
 80
 81        Returns:
 82            DataFrame with currency futures.
 83        """
 84        return self._provider.get_futures("currency")
 85
 86    @cached_property
 87    def commodity_futures(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
 88        """
 89        Get commodity futures contracts (KÄ±ymetli Madenler).
 90
 91        Includes gold, silver, platinum, palladium.
 92
 93        Returns:
 94            DataFrame with commodity futures.
 95        """
 96        return self._provider.get_futures("commodity")
 97
 98    @cached_property
 99    def options(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
100        """
101        Get all options contracts.
102
103        Returns:
104            DataFrame with columns:
105                - code: Contract code
106                - contract: Contract name
107                - price: Last price
108                - change: Price change
109                - volume_tl: Trading volume in TL
110                - volume_qty: Trading volume in contracts
111                - category: stock or index
112        """
113        return self._provider.get_options("all")
114
115    @cached_property
116    def stock_options(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
117        """
118        Get stock options contracts (Pay Opsiyon).
119
120        Returns:
121            DataFrame with options on individual stocks.
122        """
123        return self._provider.get_options("stock")
124
125    @cached_property
126    def index_options(self) -> pd.DataFrame:
127        """
128        Get index options contracts (Endeks Opsiyon).
129
130        Returns:
131            DataFrame with index options.
132        """
133        return self._provider.get_options("index")
134
135    def get_by_symbol(self, symbol: str) -> pd.DataFrame:
136        """
137        Get all derivatives for a specific underlying symbol.
138
139        Args:
140            symbol: Underlying symbol (e.g., "AKBNK", "THYAO", "XU030")
141
142        Returns:
143            DataFrame with all futures and options for the symbol.
144        """
145        symbol = symbol.upper()
146
147        futures = self._provider.get_futures("all")
148        options = self._provider.get_options("all")
149
150        # Filter out empty DataFrames before concat
151        dfs = [df for df in [futures, options] if not df.empty]
152        if not dfs:
153            return pd.DataFrame(columns=["code", "contract", "price", "change", "volume_tl", "volume_qty", "category"])
154
155        all_data = pd.concat(dfs, ignore_index=True)
156
157        # Filter by symbol in contract name or code
158        mask = (
159            all_data["contract"].str.upper().str.contains(symbol, na=False) |
160            all_data["code"].str.upper().str.contains(symbol, na=False)
161        )
162
163        return all_data[mask].reset_index(drop=True)
